segment.source: Learn how to include interstitial ads in a Windows 10, Windows 8.1, or Windows Phone 8.1 app using the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: Learn how to include interstitial ads in a Windows 10, Windows 8.1, or Windows Phone 8.1 app using the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: Interstitial ads
segment.target: Interstitial ads

segment.source: Interstitial ads
segment.target: Interstitial ads

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: This walkthrough shows how to include interstitial ads in a Windows 10, Windows 8.1, or Windows Phone 8.1 app using the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.
segment.target: This walkthrough shows how to include interstitial ads in a Windows 10, Windows 8.1, or Windows Phone 8.1 app using the Microsoft advertising libraries in the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK.

segment.source: For complete sample projects that demonstrate how to add interstitial ads to JavaScript/HTML apps and XAML apps using C# and C++, see the advertising samples on GitHub.
segment.target: For complete sample projects that demonstrate how to add interstitial ads to JavaScript/HTML apps and XAML apps using C# and C++, see the advertising samples on GitHub.

segment.source: What are interstitial ads?
segment.target: What are interstitial ads?

segment.source: Unlike banner ads, interstitial ads (or interstitials) are shown on the entire screen of the app.
segment.target: Unlike banner ads, interstitial ads (or interstitials) are shown on the entire screen of the app.

segment.source: Two basic forms are frequently used in games.
segment.target: Two basic forms are frequently used in games.

segment.source: With Paywall ads, the user must watch an ad at some regular interval.
segment.target: With Paywall ads, the user must watch an ad at some regular interval.

segment.source: For example between game levels:
segment.target: For example between game levels:

segment.source: whatisaninterstitial
segment.target: whatisaninterstitial

segment.source: With Rewards Based ads the user is explicitly seeking some benefit, such as a hint or extra time to complete the level, and initializes the video ad through the app’s user interface.
segment.target: With Rewards Based ads the user is explicitly seeking some benefit, such as a hint or extra time to complete the level, and initializes the video ad through the app’s user interface.

segment.source: It is important to note that this SDK does not handle any user interface except at the time of video playback.
segment.target: It is important to note that this SDK does not handle any user interface except at the time of video playback.

segment.source: Refer to the interstitial best practices for guidelines on what to do, and avoid, as you consider how to integrate interstitial ads in your app.
segment.target: Refer to the interstitial best practices for guidelines on what to do, and avoid, as you consider how to integrate interstitial ads in your app.

segment.source: Building an app with interstitial ads
segment.target: Building an app with interstitial ads

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK with Visual Studio 2015 or Visual Studio 2013.
segment.target: Install the Microsoft Store Engagement and Monetization SDK with Visual Studio 2015 or Visual Studio 2013.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, open your project or create a new project.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, open your project or create a new project.

segment.source: Code development
segment.target: Code development

segment.source: Steps for a XAML/.NET app
segment.target: Steps for a XAML/.NET app

segment.source: Steps for HTML/JavaScript
segment.target: Steps for HTML/JavaScript

segment.source: Steps for C++ (DirectX Interop)
segment.target: Steps for C++ (DirectX Interop)

segment.source: Interstitial ads (XAML/.NET)
segment.target: Interstitial ads (XAML/.NET)

segment.source: Note This section provides C# examples, but Visual Basic and C++ are also supported.
segment.target: Note This section provides C# examples, but Visual Basic and C++ are also supported.

segment.source: Open your project in Visual Studio.
segment.target: Open your project in Visual Studio.

segment.source: In Reference Manager, select one of the following references depending on your project type:
segment.target: In Reference Manager, select one of the following references depending on your project type:

segment.source: For a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) project: Expand Universal Windows, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Microsoft Advertising SDK for XAML (Version 10.0).
segment.target: For a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) project: Expand Universal Windows, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Microsoft Advertising SDK for XAML (Version 10.0).

segment.source: For a Windows 8.1 project: Expand Windows 8.1, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Ad Mediator SDK for Windows 8.1 XAML.
segment.target: For a Windows 8.1 project: Expand Windows 8.1, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Ad Mediator SDK for Windows 8.1 XAML.

segment.source: This option will add both the Microsoft advertising and ad mediator libraries to your project, but you can ignore the ad mediator libraries.
segment.target: This option will add both the Microsoft advertising and ad mediator libraries to your project, but you can ignore the ad mediator libraries.

segment.source: For a Windows Phone 8.1 project: Expand Windows Phone 8.1, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Ad Mediator SDK for Windows Phone 8.1 XAML.
segment.target: For a Windows Phone 8.1 project: Expand Windows Phone 8.1, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Ad Mediator SDK for Windows Phone 8.1 XAML.

segment.source: This option will add both the Microsoft advertising and ad mediator libraries to your project, but you can ignore the ad mediator libraries.
segment.target: This option will add both the Microsoft advertising and ad mediator libraries to your project, but you can ignore the ad mediator libraries.

segment.source: In the app code, include the following namespace reference.
segment.target: In the app code, include the following namespace reference.

segment.source: Declare your and properties.
segment.target: Declare your and properties.

segment.source: Note You will replace the test values with live values before submitting your app for submission.
segment.target: Note You will replace the test values with live values before submitting your app for submission.

segment.source: Instantiate an InterstitialAd, wire up all event handlers, and request an ad.
segment.target: Instantiate an InterstitialAd, wire up all event handlers, and request an ad.

segment.source: At the point in your code where the ad is to be shown, be sure the ad is ready, and show it.
segment.target: At the point in your code where the ad is to be shown, be sure the ad is ready, and show it.

segment.source: Define and code up the events.
segment.target: Define and code up the events.

segment.source: Assign the property to the test value provided in Test mode values.
segment.target: Assign the property to the test value provided in Test mode values.

segment.source: This value is used only used for testing; you will replace it with a live value before you publish your app.
segment.target: This value is used only used for testing; you will replace it with a live value before you publish your app.

segment.target: Assign the property to the test value provided in Test mode values.

segment.source: This value is used only used for testing; you will replace it with a live value before you publish your app.
segment.target: This value is used only used for testing; you will replace it with a live value before you publish your app.

segment.source: Build and test your app to confirm it is showing test ads.
segment.target: Build and test your app to confirm it is showing test ads.

segment.target: Interstitial ads (HTML/JavaScript)

segment.source: This sample assumes you have created a Universal App project for JavaScript in Visual Studio 2015 and are targeting a specific CPU.
segment.target: This sample assumes you have created a Universal App project for JavaScript in Visual Studio 2015 and are targeting a specific CPU.

segment.source: Interstitial ads (C++ and DirectX with XAML interop)
segment.target: Interstitial ads (C++ and DirectX with XAML interop)

segment.source: This sample assumes you have created a Universal App project for XAML in Visual Studio 2015 and are targeting a specific CPU architecture.
segment.target: This sample assumes you have created a Universal App project for XAML in Visual Studio 2015 and are targeting a specific CPU architecture.

segment.source: Important This code is written in C++ as required for DirectX.
segment.target: Important This code is written in C++ as required for DirectX.

segment.source: Open your project in Visual Studio.
segment.target: Open your project in Visual Studio.

segment.source: In Reference Manager, select one of the following references depending on your project type:
segment.target: In Reference Manager, select one of the following references depending on your project type:

segment.source: For a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) project: Expand Universal Windows, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Microsoft Advertising SDK for XAML (Version 10.0).
segment.target: For a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) project: Expand Universal Windows, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Microsoft Advertising SDK for XAML (Version 10.0).

segment.source: For a Windows 8.1 project: Expand Windows 8.1, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Ad Mediator SDK for Windows 8.1 XAML.
segment.target: For a Windows 8.1 project: Expand Windows 8.1, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Ad Mediator SDK for Windows 8.1 XAML.

segment.source: This option will add both the Microsoft advertising and ad mediator libraries to your project, but you can ignore the ad mediator libraries.
segment.target: This option will add both the Microsoft advertising and ad mediator libraries to your project, but you can ignore the ad mediator libraries.

segment.source: For a Windows Phone 8.1 project: Expand Windows Phone 8.1, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Ad Mediator SDK for Windows Phone 8.1 XAML.
segment.target: For a Windows Phone 8.1 project: Expand Windows Phone 8.1, click Extensions, and then select the check box next to Ad Mediator SDK for Windows Phone 8.1 XAML.

segment.source: This option will add both the Microsoft advertising and ad mediator libraries to your project, but you can ignore the ad mediator libraries.
segment.target: This option will add both the Microsoft advertising and ad mediator libraries to your project, but you can ignore the ad mediator libraries.

segment.source: In the appropriate header file for your app, declare the interstitial ad object and related properties/methods.
segment.target: In the appropriate header file for your app, declare the interstitial ad object and related properties/methods.

segment.source: Declare your and properties.
segment.target: Declare your and properties.

segment.source: In the .cpp file, add a namespace reference.
segment.target: In the .cpp file, add a namespace reference.

segment.source: Instantiate an InterstitialAd, wire up all event handlers, and request an ad.
segment.target: Instantiate an InterstitialAd, wire up all event handlers, and request an ad.

segment.source: At the point in your code where the ad is to be shown, be sure the ad is ready, and show it.
segment.target: At the point in your code where the ad is to be shown, be sure the ad is ready, and show it.

segment.source: Define and code up the events.
segment.target: Define and code up the events.

segment.source: Assign the property to the test value provided in Test mode values.
segment.target: Assign the property to the test value provided in Test mode values.

segment.source: This value is used only used for testing; you will replace it with a live value before you publish your app.
segment.target: This value is used only used for testing; you will replace it with a live value before you publish your app.

segment.source: Assign the property to the test value provided in Test mode values.
segment.target: Assign the property to the test value provided in Test mode values.

segment.source: This value is used only used for testing; you will replace it with a live value before you publish your app.
segment.target: This value is used only used for testing; you will replace it with a live value before you publish your app.

segment.source: Build and test your app to confirm it is showing test ads.
segment.target: Build and test your app to confirm it is showing test ads.

segment.source: Release your app with live ads using Windows Dev Center
segment.target: Release your app with live ads using Windows Dev Center

segment.source: In the Dev Center dashboard, go to the MonetizationMonetize with ads page for your app, and create a standalone Microsoft Advertising unit.
segment.target: In the Dev Center dashboard, go to the MonetizationMonetize with ads page for your app, and create a standalone Microsoft Advertising unit.

segment.source: For the ad unit type, specify Video interstitial.
segment.target: For the ad unit type, specify Video interstitial.

segment.source: Make note of both the ad unit ID and the application ID.
segment.target: Make note of both the ad unit ID and the application ID.

segment.source: In your code, replace the test ad unit values with the live values you generated in Dev Center.
segment.target: In your code, replace the test ad unit values with the live values you generated in Dev Center.

segment.source: Submit your app to the Store using the Windows Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: Submit your app to the Store using the Windows Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: Review your advertising performance reports in the Dev Center dashboard.
segment.target: Review your advertising performance reports in the Dev Center dashboard.

segment.source: Interstitial best practices
segment.target: Interstitial best practices

segment.source: For more information about how to use interstitial ads effectively, see UI and user experience guidelines.
segment.target: For more information about how to use interstitial ads effectively, see UI and user experience guidelines.

segment.source: Remove reference errors: target a specific CPU platform (XAML and HTML)
segment.target: Remove reference errors: target a specific CPU platform (XAML and HTML)

segment.source: When using the Microsoft advertising libraries, you cannot target Any CPU in your project.
segment.target: When using the Microsoft advertising libraries, you cannot target Any CPU in your project.

segment.source: If your project targets the Any CPU platform, you may see a warning in your project after you add a reference to the Microsoft advertising libraries.
segment.target: If your project targets the Any CPU platform, you may see a warning in your project after you add a reference to the Microsoft advertising libraries.

segment.source: To remove this warning, update your project to use an architecture-specific build output (for example, x86).
segment.target: To remove this warning, update your project to use an architecture-specific build output (for example, x86).

segment.source: For more information, see Known issues.
segment.target: For more information, see Known issues.
